programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts explore the controversy surrounding the ancient Crystal Skulls, asking what powers might be unleashed if all 13 artefacts were brought together.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into the power of the number three in history, science and astronomy, and its possible links to extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Twenty-year veteran trucker Yogi is on a mercy mission, leading a hay convoy to the drought-ravaged farmers of New South Wales..

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Livestock trucker Troy Coombe is facing wild weather and wild passengers, transporting two ostriches to their new home..

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Funk singer George Clinton challenges Rick and the team to return a 1920s grand piano to its former glory.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a 1950s table hockey game while the team work on a slot machine that rewards winners with cigars instead of money.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman sells an artistic statue of an old woman in a bathing suit, but when Les buys it, Seth blames Ashley for contributing to the purchase.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The store is divided as Ashley and Seth lay claim to their own individual turfs, while a fake ID puts Les in an awkward situation. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts search ancient accounts of magic for evidence suggesting that the wizards and witches of yesteryear were given otherworldly knowledge by aliens.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: A disappearing US pilot, unexplained incidents at a Sicilian fishing village and a mysterious encounter on a routine training flight over Germany in 1952.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers visit the Dallas suburb of Addison, where the Rangers find a nautical antique and Jenny uncovers a piece of Hollywood memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Seth continue continue their tense stand-off, but a demanding customer forces them to band together. A signed and authenticated Elvis record stimulates interest, but Les and Rich are wary of paying too much for it.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Matters come to a head when Rich invades Ashley's territory in the jewellery and loan department.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The 80s have taken over as the Pawn Stars look back at some of their favourite items..

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys start looking for a new employee to cover the night shift, and examine a collection of antique cast-iron piggy banks and a triple-barrelled gun.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The competition grows fierce at auctions in North Hollywood, and even Dan and Laura struggle to stay ahead of the game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave gets help from his friends at a vault auction, but Mary's inexperience leaves her empty-handed.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Las Vegas, where they acquire a 1950s bumper car and a potato gun launcher.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones bid for large units in Las Vegas, discovering an antique naval cane sword and a magician's prop from the 1970s.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A locker at an auction in Arlington catches Vic's eye, but Bubba suspects it could have been used for shady dealings.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba are cautiously optimistic as they head to auctions in Mesquite, Nevada, a location that has not proven to be particularly fruitful for them in the past.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when an Ethiopian Airlines flight ran out of fuel and plunged 31,000 feet, and how the pilot attempted to save everyone onboard.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate why so many UFOs have been spotted near remote islands, and consider whether the remote outposts could be the earthly homes of aliens.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley hires a woman to work at the jewellery counter, without consulting with Seth or Les. Questions about Ashley's skills are raised after suspicious transactions.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les orders Seth and Rich to clean up the warehouse to make room for new merchandise. When nothing is done, the owner has doubts that his children are cut out for business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: American Jewelry celebrates its 30th anniversary, and Les wants to put on a big celebration He assigns Seth and Ashley five days to plan it, but they clash over their ideas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A sloppy mistake puts the Golds' business in jeopardy, and a dispute on the shop floor gets out of hand.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones attend an auction in Los Angeles, where they acquire an autographed 1960s tattoo machine, a competition chainsaw and a cedar bear.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones buy a fighting cage and a vintage carnival game in California.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must forge not just one, but three knives from railroad spikes in only three hours. Time management is essential for hammering out three functional knives that can withstand a brutal round of testing. After two smith's knives go off the rails, the remaining two competitors return to recreate the iconic Medieval Arming Sword.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: From his Norwich forge and using his remarkable skills honed over a decade, YouTube personality and blacksmith Alec Steele tests himself by attempting to create a Falchion - a curved-edge knife with a clip point blade.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: Blacksmith and YouTube personality Alec Steele takes on the Karambit knife in his Norwich forge.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod tries Brandi's patience as the bidders attend an auction in Koreatown, where valuable merchandise is up for grabs and Dave hopes to make a big profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An auction is held on Darrell and Brandon's home turf, and Mary hatches a plan to deal with inflated prices.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sara Pascoe, Larry Dean, Gary Delaney
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, warming up the audience and then introducing routines by Larry Dean and Gary Delaney.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis host a festive special and are joined by an array of top names form the UK comedy circuit including Ed Byrne, James Acaster, Tom Allen, Rhys James, Zoe Lyons, Ed Gamble, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan for quizzes, challenges, out-takes and unseen material.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Ross Noble, R'n'B singer Jamelia and academic Germaine Greer to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include folk-dancing, health-and-safety, text speak, smelly people, actors and fun-runs.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former deputy prime minister John Prescott, actress Rebecca Front and comedian Micky Flanagan join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include goal celebrations, school ties, celebrity chefs, audience participation and other people's music.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon breaks the hospital's new multi-million-pound surgical robot and has to fix it before a YouTube star goes under the knife.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys hit the jackpot when they unearth a valuable relic from a famous plantation home, and a Chevy dealership turns up further goodies.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Jesse and Brandon argue, giving Scott and Chrissy a chance to jump in with their bid.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: The bidders head to Marina del Rey, California, in search of nautical equipment.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist ventures into uncharted territory in pursuit of new discoveries. He takes on physical challenges, encounters extraordinary wildlife and meets remarkable people. In the first edition, Steve and a team of climbers and jungle survival experts head into the ancient landscape of South America's Guiana Shield. This vast wilderness of pristine forests and towering table-top mountains is one of the most inaccessible terrains on the planet.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Presenters Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond tackle the traffic chaos snowy weather causes in Britain, and hit upon a solution involving a combine harvester, some rudimentary engineering skills and a trip to Norway. Jeremy also tests the Audi RS5 and the BMW M3, and American actress and model Amber Heard is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event in Peru, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Featuring all the thrills and spills from the 2013 Red Bull Soapbox Race in London, as the crews unleash their four-wheeled, motorless creations on a challenging downhill course littered with obstacles.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain - with distinctly mixed results.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Jaguar XJ and races against the rotation of the Earth. James May travels to America to drive a Nasa Space Exploration Vehicle and Richard Hammond tests two of the most famous supercars of the 1980s - the Porsche 959 and the Ferrari F40. John Prescott is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Ross Noble, R'n'B singer Jamelia and academic Germaine Greer to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include folk-dancing, health-and-safety, text speak, smelly people, actors and fun-runs.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former deputy prime minister John Prescott, actress Rebecca Front and comedian Micky Flanagan join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include goal celebrations, school ties, celebrity chefs, audience participation and other people's music.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress Tracey Ullman hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from April 2018, with comedian James Acaster and Sky News journalist Beth Rigby joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests David Mitchell, Rob Brydon, Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. The host asks questions on the topic of history, awarding points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Countdown presenter (and Apprentice sidekick) Nick Hewer squares off against his show's former maths whizz Carol Vorderman and comedian Rhod Gilbert, making the case with host Frank Skinner for their gripes and pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include train managers, camping, Facebook, golf, holidays and advertising slogans.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: The couple are thrilled when they are finally invited to Jonathan Ross's Halloween party, where Lucy is very excited to meet Jason Donovan.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: Documentary following father-and-son duo Dave and Steve Nuwar, who run a military antiques business. In the first edition, Dave takes a gamble when he makes one of his most expensive purchases ever. And with finances tight, the team head to Stratford fair to try and sell some treasures.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A team of engineers fight to return a veteran Westland Wessex helicopter to the skies - 30 years after its last flight.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part two of two. How the 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt was ultimately defeated, but secured a lasting legacy by marking the birth of Egyptology.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Historian Stephen Baxter explores his own theory that the Domesday Book was commissioned to confer revolutionary powers on the monarchy in the 11th century, and not intended as a means to collect taxes. He examines how the first great national survey, which recorded who owned every piece of land and property in England, was a massive logistical exercise that documented the traumatic impact of the Norman Conquest.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day recreates the case of a soldier who returned from the front line of the Second World War with a terrible urge to kill.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The theories surrounding the death of Hermann Goering, who managed to cheat the hangman by taking a cyanide capsule on the day before his scheduled death.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The remains of three U-boats discovered in the Bristol Channel. Their exact identity and how they came to be there is not known, so divers explore the wrecks and with the help of British and German experts reveal the mystery submarines. Series investigating deep-sea wrecks off the south-west coast of England.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels from Bangkok in Thailand to Mandalay in Myanmar, tracing the route of the notorious Burma-Siam Railway. The 250-mile line was built by the Japanese during the Second World War using enslaved Asian workers and Allied PoWs, and Chris visits the famous site of the Bridge on the River Kwai along the way.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The theories, conspiracies and facts relating to Rudolf Hess's dramatic flight to Scotland in 1941 and his subsequent death in Spandau prison.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Field Marshal Montgomery's daring airborne plan to end the war by Christmas, which went a bridge too far at Arnhem.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Spoonerisms galore with Barker and Corbett, and another instalment of the gripping Death Can Be Fatal, with a musical finale to finish.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Continuing the saga of Death Can Be Fatal, as well as a guest appearance from the Aldershot Brass Ensemble and Patrick Moore's brother.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Burke promises to help an old flame working for a politician who is in trouble for accepting funds from an underworld figure. The investigation into the criminal leads Burke to a shady escort agency, but the case and his reputation are jeopardised when he is caught on camera leaving the building after a raid by vice officers. Detective drama, starring Alex Norton.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: Joe's future in the army hangs in the balance, as Honor struggles to cope with the revelations about his secret past. Markham is torn between his duty and his conscience, while Armstrong fears for Yusra's safety.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The pretender exposes King Henry's weaknesses, while Lizzie confronts new demons and old curses. Concluding the sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages as the War of the Roses comes to an end. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry is forced to confront his past when the team reinvestigates the 33-year-old murder of a doctor whose body was found hanging from a meat hook on a butcher's stall at Smithfield Market. The butcher had gone missing on the same day, and since then the community has rallied to help his widow keep the business afloat. However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave and Donna's relationship is threatened, and Paddy Garvey and Nancy Thorpe make some important decisions. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Brad Connor is devastated to learn he may be HIV positive, and makes a drunken pass at Marsha Stubbs. Joy Wilton discovers the joys of mixing work with pleasure.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna's past comes back to haunt her when she meets the teenager who asked her for an abortion pill a few weeks earlier. It transpires the girl is now pregnant again, and her mother shows up at the hospital to find out exactly what's going on. Matters are further complicated when Owen learns she is only 15 years old - and also discovers how the nurses falsified her records. Meanwhile, Connie begins to lose patience with Elliot.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Amy brings baby Milo to see everyone on her way home. Meanwhile, Eve and Gerry want to throw Frank out when they catch him about to take drugs in the toilets.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina tries to quell suspicion about her unexplained absences by going on the beat with Amber and Dan - only to be punched hard in the stomach by a suspect. Smithy reprimands Margaret and Roger for gossiping about Ramani's state of mind, and Honey prepares to lie on Scott's behalf in a bid to get him out of jail, while Lance pledges to leave no stone unturned in his quest to secure incriminating evidence against gangster Adi Mateen.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack is questioned about Vicki's disappearance as the search for her intensifies.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A routine inspection of a theatre ends in tragedy when a lighting rig falls on top of Colin. Elsewhere, Hallam considers taking on a job outside the brigade.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Duncan's pen-pal comes to stay, but it soon transpires he has been less than truthful in his letters to her, implying he not only owns Glenbogle, but is the Laird. Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie, Hamish Clark and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates corporate scandals on Jersey while Danielle grows convinced his life is in danger, but nobody will believe her. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's poetry is to be published, much to the delight of his Italian girlfriend. Joeys and Jack's love lives, however, are in deep trouble.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted has a chance of stardom when he is hired as a late replacement at an uptown show for a fellow comedian. It is rumoured that talent scouts from the TV show Opportunity Knocks will be in the audience. Classic comedy following life at Maplin's holiday camp, starring Paul Shane, Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.sub-title: The World Will Always Welcome Lovers
programme.desc: The truth about Alistair's wedding nerves is revealed after he and Lionel spill the beans, but Rocky comes to the rescue to ensure the ceremony finally takes place. Jean refuses to give up on her efforts to play Cupid between Harry and Sandy.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers that an infirm friend needs help to bury his pet in the churchyard, and calls on Alvin and Entwistle to carry out the deed. However, the mission becomes complicated when the police begin to suspect the trio are up to no good. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Burt Kwouk and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The mismatched detectives investigate the murder of businessman Richard Mattis and discover a family tormented by sinister secrets. A second body found in the canal behind Mattis's factory makes matters even more puzzling. Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan and Alison Steadman star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man admitted to hospital after a traffic accident turns out to be one of two children who disappeared without trace 15 years previously. At the time, a nationwide manhunt failed to produce any answers, and now the cold case squad investigates where the missing boy has been all this time and whether his twin sister is still alive. Detective drama, starring Trevor Eve.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Jones.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's leading stories with Anna Botting.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Peter Cole is worried about the press interest following Maggie's interview and the online petition calling for his resignation over the scandal. Meanwhile, Alex is greeted at work by two money lenders, who have found him because his girlfriend Roxanna's picture appeared in the papers. Author Marcus Ormansby gives a talk at the school, and finds that romance is blossoming between him and Jill. Later, Maggie's visit to Kelly's salon is tense, but they have a heart to heart, leading Kelly to return home to husband Neil and take action over their 'lottery' money.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family and friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and topical studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder's Crime Stories
programme.desc: Robert Rinder examines the murders of police officers Nicola Hughes and Fiona Bone in 2012, hearing about their fathers' efforts to fundraise in their daughters' memories.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five family members from Dunstable answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Becky, Sue, Jonny and Simon pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: There is an underlying tension between Paddy and Chas. Jacob starts to suspect that Pollard might like Brenda a little more than he is making out, and David gets some good news.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: It becomes clear that Gemma is not coping with motherhood and even the health visitor question her about her state of mind. But later, as the babies' crying escalates, she heads into the yard to calm herself - and realises with horror she is locked out. Alya introduces Yasmeen to a police officer who has information about Geoff - but scared, she refuses to listen and rushed out. David begs Clayton to leave Shona alone, Tyrone gives Arthur a piece of his mind for standing Evelyn up, and Norris reluctantly joins Ken for the Stillwaters' art class.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: The sunny summer season continues, as the Richardsons celebrate a christening at the Cathedral, Jeremy and Stuart have a big performance and Dean Sarah has her portrait painted. Siriol Jenkins narrates.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bernie arrives to find Gemma in such a distressed state, so she agrees to move in and help with the babies - on the condition that she doesn't tell Chesney that Gemma isn't coping. Nick tries to talk to Shona but she refuses to see him, passing on a message to David instead. Arthur apologises to Evelyn and asks her to give him another chance, and Ken and Norris sneak out to the Rovers for a treat.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: As the investigation takes a shocking turn, secrets rise to the surface. When Andrew was living in Edinburgh, a strange turn of events brought him face to face with an old acquaintance, whose deeply corrosive influence becomes clear. Meanwhile, the tragic recent history of Laura's family helps explain the deep bond she and Katy share, as well as the lengths Laura will go to for those she loves. Will her past catch up with her, just as Andrew's did? Thriller, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Serial Killer with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: The broadcaster meets Bronx businessman Alex Henriquez, who was convicted for three murders in 1992. The victims had two things in common - they were all asphyxiated before being dumped by the highway and all three could be placed with Alex Henriquez shortly before their deaths. For 30 years the killer has protested his innocence, claiming the police set him up. Piers Morgan tries to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: The previous season, Darrell Miklos located a shipwreck tied to Christopher Columbus using Cooper's intel. Now, he has eight weeks' of cash left to find another shipwreck that he can salvage.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: A team of experts recreates the famed bullet catch trick to uncover how Houdini could have accomplished it.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Sergeant Major visits Spain on a top-secret mission transporting the British Army's brand new scout vehicle from Seville to Newport, Wales. Plus, Trucker Tom faces a midnight run.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Teutul Sr arranges for work to be done on the shop in exchange for building custom bikes for the contractors.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Steve has only driven his 1969 Camaro Z28 at five miles-per-hour, though he still wants it to be a muscle car beast. Scott wants to revive a rare matching numbers 1964 Corvette.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Tom asks Dan to find him a rare 1967 Camaro Convertible with factory air conditioning. However, when Dan finds the Unicorn, the car is too good to cut up.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Revealing how items such as sidecars, frozen French toast, refrigerator compressors and superchargers are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Revealing how items such as sidecars, frozen French toast, refrigerator compressors and superchargers are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the world's sharpest photos are taken. Plus, the stitching of an airbag capable of catching a falling car, and the manufacture of billions of perfectly-formed jelly beans.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A skipper comes to regret instructing his crew to go outside in savage weather to save the ship.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Important relationships begin to fray as the season wears on, with the challenges of finding gold weighing heavy on the miners' minds.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Meeting the people who drive some of the heaviest and least manoeuvrable vehicles along some of Australia's toughest highways.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a 1976 Porsche 911 Targa for 5,000, hoping Edd China will be able to work his magic on it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes the Porsche 911 Targa, refurbishing the gearbox, improving the roof seal and spraying it black. Mike Brewer then tries to maximise its price.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes his newly restored 1964 Ferrari Lusso and 1957 Mercedes 300SL Gullwing to an auction in Scottsdale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits the collection of deceased car dealer Lee Roy Hartung and finds original motorcycles at an auction.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.desc: When an underwater image of a shipwreck suggests the crew is to blame, the families of the dead refuse to believe it and launch an intensive quest for answers.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Three weeks of long hours and horrendous conditions cause tempers to fray and the men begin to turn on one another. Elsewhere, ice stands between a skipper and the safety of the harbour.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Gold fever is on the rise as the fleet races to find fortune before the season ends, and one miner turns treacherous by leaking valuable information to the competition.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard goes to the biggest antiques emporium he's ever visited and a Somerset antique shop. At a grand school in Ipswich, Suffolk, he uncovers a historical artifact that leaves him speechless.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Rain hampers Robbie's efforts to truck a home to the Gold Coast. Meanwhile, Graham faces storms and grass fires moving a section of railway 5,000 kilometres in just five days.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China sets Mike Brewer the task of finding him a classic American truck. Mike heads to Sonoma County where he meets his first hipster and her Chevy LUV.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien hope a clay pigeon trap, a searchlight and a Peugeot 205 will help make a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is impressed by a remarkable library in Manchester, before he is frustrated by a fellow dealer in Chorley, Lancashire. The presenter also stumbles upon a potentially valuable chair.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen dodge rockfalls in a potentially deadly new mine. The Fire Crew closes in on a new deposit of precious black opal, while the Boulder Boys struggle to drain their opal pit.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Captain Andy Hillstrand returns to discover the Time Bandit is in disarray, while Jake Anderson gets ready to captain the Saga for the first time.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How 10 million copies a day are printed of the world's best-selling newspaper. Plus, 32,000 pairs of socks a day are knitted at South Africa's biggest sock factory.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of 99 per cent of America's raisins in California's San Joaquin Valley. Plus, the manufacture of the world's oldest type of paper.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Officers find themselves having to reassemble a computer disk cut up with pinking shears in order to solve a brutal murder case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tiny pieces of plastic - the size of grains of sand - provide police with clues after a bombing in which a man was killed.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Rhonda Daugherty vanished, detectives turned to the public for information. A tip led to surveillance footage from a hotel that uncovered a journey of deceit.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The deaths of Alabama country store owner Billy Triplett and his wife Debbie in June 2001. Locals suspected their fate must have been connected with his illegal side-business of retailing alcohol. However, when word of a bloodstained stash of money reached investigators, they were shocked to realise the identity of the person wishing to conceal it.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Bureau agents up with police to launch a complex operation to catch a violent gang of thieves that specialises in targeting armoured cars.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The investigators travel to the city's west side to investigate reports of a dog in distress and find the animal is entangled in wire.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Pluto the singing dog is having problems with his voice, causing concern for Dr Chris. Tim tackles a territorial Tasmanian Devil, and can Lisa save a desperately ill kitten?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Featuring Sarah, a plus-size bride who has tried on nearly 20 unsatisfactory dresses, and Sofia, who wants to lose more than a stone for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Social media superstar Claudia Oshry hits Kleinfeld with her opinionated sisters, and Baton Rouge bride Kelli Hutchinson gets the surprise of a lifetime.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a tiger with toothache and checks on some puppies that will be trained into guide dogs. Meanwhile, Lisa battles to save a much-loved Pomeranian.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown delivers a litter of 10 assistance-dog puppies and helps a kitten in a critical condition after a freak accident. Plus, a snake is seriously injured.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown helps celebrity bull Bully, whose horn is growing into its head, and it is discovered that turtles are starving off the coast of Cairns.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A five-week-old puppy is struggling to walk, a cat and a snake are brought into the clinic after having a fierce fight and a water dragon causes mayhem.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A heat-exhausted domestic rabbit is abandoned in a car park, but proves tricky to catch. Investigator Mark persuades the owner of six underfed dogs to give them more food.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Mark rescues a dog with open wounds from a crate and firefighters try to reach a cat stuck 40ft up a palm tree in fierce winds.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three cases in which investigators had to apply their extensive expertise to apprehend murderers who had killed for money.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 32-year-old Brandy Hanna, who vanished in May 2005 after leaving her North Charleston home for a weekend away. After failing to return to the restaurant where she was employed the following Monday, North Charleston police officers had to contemplate whether she had walked away from her rocky love life or was the victim of a sinister crime.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of stonemason David Riemens, who attended one final meeting before driving home to visit his family. Soon after, his truck was found abandoned - with the 60-year-old nowhere to be seen.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a 21-year-old mother failed to return from night classes, before her car was found burned out. Investigators immediately suspected foul play, but no one was prepared for the web of lies that unravelled following her disappearance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Are You Ready to Play Bridal Blitz?
programme.desc: A bride agreed to marry her fiance after only six weeks of dating - but it has already taken longer than that for her to choose a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride wants to get married in a black dress, but her parents would prefer something more traditional. A plan to customise a 100-year-old dress does not go to plan.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori and Monte take their business on the road, and come to the aid of a bride who is getting married in two days.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori and Monte visit Nashville help country singer Jimmy Stanley propose to fellow artist Kristen Kelly.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride disagrees with her wedding planner, and a customer's mother does not intend to make the fitting an easy experience.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Raucous bride Stacy is back to find another dress to reflect her motorcycle-chic style. Plus, bride Jessica wants a modern dress for her beach wedding.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items destined for the tip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, including an old dressing table, a pair of dowdy chairs, and some discarded carpet.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan values a handbag believed to once belong to singer Cheryl, and finds a pair of designer Tom Ford shoes that could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charity, who lost over 400lbs and now fears that her daughter is also becoming dangerously obese, and Milla, who is seeking gastric bypass surgery.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The blow up between Kody and Christine continues and escalates even more as they approach their final destination. Can Kody get to the root of the problem?.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride Marta's mum and sister have flown in from Spain to see the final fitting, but, after breaking her ankle, can Jo and Al help Marta on her big day?.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Insight into the manhunt for tracker Claude Dallas, who shot two sheriffs dead before disappearing into the mountains of Idaho. Knowing Dallas could stay hidden indefinitely, the FBI were forced to employ unique tactics and set up a modern-day posse to track him down.
